1.text: This third time do I come unto you; on the mouth of two witnesses or three shall every saying be established;

2.text: I have said before, and I say it before, as being present, the second time, and being absent, now, do I write to those having sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare,

3.text: since a proof ye seek of the Christ speaking in me, who to you is not infirm, but is powerful in you,

4.text: for even if he was crucified from infirmity, yet he doth live from the power of God; for we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him from the power of God toward you.

5.text: Your own selves try ye, if ye are in the faith; your own selves prove ye; do ye not know your own selves, that Jesus Christ is in you, if ye be not in some respect disapproved of?

6.text: and I hope that ye shall know that we—we are not disapproved of;

7.text: and I pray before God that ye do no evil, not that we may appear approved, but that ye may do that which is right, and we may be as disapproved;

8.text: for we are not able to do anything against the truth, but for the truth;

9.text: for we rejoice when we may be infirm, and ye may be powerful; and this also we pray for—your perfection!

10.text: because of this, these things—being absent—I write, that being present, I may not treat any sharply, according to the authority that the Lord did give me for building up, and not for casting down.

11.text: Henceforth, brethren, rejoice; be made perfect, be comforted, be of the same mind, be at peace, and the God of the love and peace shall be with you;

12.text: salute one another in an holy kiss;

13.text: salute you do all the saints;

14.text: the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, is with you all! Amen.
